question:
About 78% of sewage generated in India is untreated according to reports. Which of the following statements, about the steps taken for dealing with this issue, are correct?
  1. Sewage Sludge Hygienisation Plant- a pilot project- in Ahmedabad makes use of radiation technology to treat sludge.
  2. Sludge Hygienisation Research Irradiator in Vadodara was set up by IGCAR.
  3. Energy can be generated from STPs.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The plant in Ahmedabad was set up as a technology demonstration pilot project. The project is a joint effort by BARC and Ahmedabad’s municipal corporation. It will make use of radiation technology to hygienize the sludge from the sewage. A huge portion of sewage is water, while a small portion is made of organic components. These components are sterilised by use of radiation from radioactive cobalt isotope (Co-60). Statement 2 is incorrect: Vadodara’s SHRI project was set up by BARC/ Bhabha Atomic Research centre. This was in collaboration with Vadodara’s municipal corporation and has been operational for about 3 decades. It also makes use of Co-60 radiations- gamma radiations. It treats sewage with about 3-4% solids. Statement 3 is correct: It is possible to generate energy from STP. Such an STP was setup in Bengaluru in 2017 with the aid of JICA/ Japan International Corporation Agency. The STP makes use of Activated Sludge Process- one of the most common techniques used by STP across India. It makes use of Biological Nutrient Removal Technology. It has a capacity for 1MW power.
